application.model

Class GamemodeTwo

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.model.GamemodeTwo

  • public class GamemodeTwo
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Team Garbage This class is the model code for GamemodeTwo GamemodeTwo runs the major interactions between the player, the enemies, and the game methods in this class keep track of lives, score, whether enemies needs to be spawned or removed, and whether the game is playable, paused, or has ended

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double DIFFICULTY_VALUE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      GamemodeTwo(GameTwoController controller) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkWord(java.lang.String input)
      checkWord checks whether the word the player has typed matches with the words on the enemies.
      void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      draws the enemies and adds death effects when an enemy is removed once an enemy has been removed, tru is set back to false lives are also drawn in this method, number of hearts drawn depend on the number of lives the player has
      void gameOver()
      if set to true, this method ends the game
      void setPaused(boolean paused)
      if set to true, this method pauses the game
      void update()
      update tracks whether an enemy has gone past the player if so the player looses a life and the scoreModifier bonus is reset if lives decrease down to 0 the gameOver method is called if no sharks are on screen a shark is spawned also difficulty values are updated here

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • checkWord

        public void checkWord(java.lang.String input)
        checkWord checks whether the word the player has typed matches with the words on the enemies. If it does it sets the boolean variable tru to true, it increases the players score, and it adds a bonus to the scoreModifier. Else the scoreModifier is reset so a bonus score isn't applied to missed words
        Parameters:
        input - //the word the player types

      • update

        public void update()
        update tracks whether an enemy has gone past the player if so the player looses a life and the scoreModifier bonus is reset if lives decrease down to 0 the gameOver method is called if no sharks are on screen a shark is spawned also difficulty values are updated here

      • draw

        public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        draws the enemies and adds death effects when an enemy is removed once an enemy has been removed, tru is set back to false lives are also drawn in this method, number of hearts drawn depend on the number of lives the player has
        Parameters:
        gc -

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean paused)
        if set to true, this method pauses the game
        Parameters:
        paused -

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        if set to true, this method ends the game
